messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Whispering Woods Whodunit DATE: 02/02/73 The courtroom was a theater of earnest interrogations as the trial advanced. The prosecution brought forth the officers integral to the investigation to disclose their findings. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Lieutenant A. B. Baker, the lead investigator in this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Lieutenant Baker. Can you detail the events on the morning the whodunit was discovered? WITNESS: Certainly. On the morning of June 6th, Officer C. D. Davis detected an unusual scene in the woods and reported it. The investigation got underway without delay. PROSECUTOR: Who spearheaded the forensic examination? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Foster and Technician G. H. Harris led the forensic analysis. PROSECUTOR: Who conducted the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Jackson and K. L. King undertook the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense initiated a rigorous cross-examination of Lieutenant Baker concerning the investigative procedures. Throughout the trial, Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson, Patrol Officer O. P. Parker, and Patrol Officer Q. R. Quinn were also summoned to testify.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lieutenant A. B. Baker 
Officer Context: Lieutenant Baker is the lead investigator in the Whispering Woods Whodunit case, detailing the events on the morning the whodunit was discovered during the trial. 
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Davis 
Officer Context: Officer Davis noticed an unusual scene in the woods on the morning of June 6th, which initiated the investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Foster 
Officer Context: Sergeant Foster, alongside Technician G. H. Harris, spearheaded the forensic examination related to the case. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Harris 
Officer Context: Technician Harris worked with Sergeant E. F. Foster on the forensic analysis concerning the unusual scene in the woods. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Jackson 
Officer Context: Detective Jackson, alongside Detective K. L. King, conducted interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses to gather more information regarding the whodunit. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. King 
Officer Context: Detective King, along with Detective I. J. Jackson, was tasked with interrogating individuals to collect additional information about the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Nelson was summoned to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer O. P. Parker 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Parker was also brought to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer Q. R. Quinn 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Quinn was called to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer
